reviewText: I am an avid romance reader, and when  books like this started coming out in video, I bought the whole collection. Yes I do still have them for my VCR, but now a days everything is coming out on DVD, so I decided to purchase this. This type of romance DVD isn't for everyone, but if you enjoy good novels recreated as a movie, then you may enjoy this one.
I loved this movie when I could catch it on Lifetime Movie Network or WE. My husband bought me the DVD for Sweetest Day. I love it. No commercials & I can watch it whenever I want!
The DVD arrived promptly and in great condition, and it's been fun to watch--thanks!
Great old movie. Great old stars. Beautiful settings. Great family entertainment.  I enjoy movies from this era.  I would recommend to all.

This is a miniseries that will keep your attention for sure. It's combination of a plot, romance, tragedy & reunion of sorts. Well written & Lisa's acting is superb.
You will have to see it for yourself & you won't be disappointed if you are a Lisa Hartman fan.
This is a soap opera fan treat.  All actors in this movie was in a soap of some kind. Either daytime or nighttime soap opera.
The movie is great.  The characters are good.  However, the quality and sound of the movie is not very good.

I remember this movie from some time ago. I have been a fan of Lisa Hartman since her Tabitha days. This movie was like going back to high school, big hair and shoulder pads. Linda Evans will always be a Dynasty Diva no matter what.. It is predictable, good fun. For those who like the Harlequin movies, you will enjoy this.
This movie was a sheer treat.  Lisa Hartman Black and Linda Evans in the same movie.  Yes I enjoyed it and would recommend it.

Wow, besides being a fun movie with a great cast and story, for anyone from Orange County California, think THE IRVINE FAMILY RANCH....It will give you a whole new story to think about.  Would love to know if anyone else sees the similarities....
I really enjoyed the movie "Dazzle".  I love movies with romance in them.  Lisa Hartman Black and Bruce Greenwood were great.

What can you say about a movie...with today's so called "realistic movies,or those that have so called "social messages", the old ones are such a relief to watch. We watch movies for entertainment value and are able to relax and enjoy. This is a wonderful movie and ends "everyone lives happily ever after. No thought, or worry involved. A nice break from the day.
I'm so glad we can still purchase them..no matter how corney they are.
Love romance and soap opera movies
Great movie!
Great movie
very good, reccomend
I hadn't watched this in decades and it holds up
I'm glad I was able to watch this movie again.  I realized it's not the best written story because of it's predictability, but it's a great rainy day type of movie.
I love her movies.
i enjoy all of judith krantz movies

I'm a big fan of Judith Krantz books, and I always loved Dazzle because of the character, who reminded me of the female protagonist in I'll Take Manhattan.

However, the story is practically unrecognizable other than the names of the characters and some very basic sketchings of the plot. Present-day things, things that happened ten years ago, and things that happened twenty years ago are all mashed together in a single time period. Most of the plot -- particularly the moxie that made Jazz so interesting -- is gone. Plus Lisa Hartman looks way too old.

If I wasn't comparing it with the book, it might have been okay, but I was looking for a retelling on the order of Mistral's Daughter, which I thought was a much better re-creation.
PERFECT
